quests.name: Essence Voice
quests.description: Where did your essence voice show up in your work today
quests.placeholder: What was the situation? What were you doing?
quests.learnMore:
Tracking when your essence shows up helps you identify how aligned your work is with your essence.

You're training your awareness so you can show-up from this place more often.

quests.name: Protective Voice
quests.description: Where did your protective voice emerge in your work today?
quests.placeholder: What was the situation? What caused it to arise?
quests.learnMore:
Your protective voice is a coping mechanism you developed to keep yourself safe from rejection, failure, or pain.

Recognising when it activates is the first step to changing how we show up in the future.

quests.name: Positive Frequency
quests.description: What's a moment where you were challenged in your work today but reacted from a place of love?
quests.placeholder: What was the situation?
quests.learnMore:
A love response is anything above 'courage' on the emotional frequency scale.

It includes:
Willingness: 'Expressesing feelings without blame'.
Acceptance: 'Making decisions from clarity, not emotion'.
Peace: 'Seeing innocence in others, even in conflict'.

This is important because we attract what we are. If we find ourselves responding from anger throughout the day we will attract more anger. If we show up from these higher states we will attract more of them.

Tracking these moments builds awareness and accountability.

quests.name: Negative Frequency
quests.description: What's a moment you were challenged in your work today and reacted from a place of fear?
quests.placeholder: What was the situation? What caused you to be triggered?
quests.learnMore:
A fear response is anything below 'courage' on the emotional frequency scale.

It includes Anger: 'Blaming or pointing out what others did wrong'.
Fear: 'Hesitating or avoiding taking action'.
Shame: 'Going quiet / withdrawing emotionally or physically'.

This is important because we attract more of what we are. If we show up from fear we limit our growth and opportunities that align with what we love.

Tracking these moments builds awareness about what's causing us to react from fear and build accountability to show up from love in the future.

quests.name: Daily Flow Update
quests.description: Log how things flowed for you today using the Flow Compass
quests.placeholder: What happened? What direction did you flow?
quests.learnMore:
Internal flow = excitement or tired.

Does the thought of the action excite you or tire you?

External flow = Ease or resistance.

When you took action did your intentions came to life as expected and did serendipity's occur? This is Ease.

Or did it not go as expected and did you face unexpected challenges? This is resistance.

North = Action excited you and it flowed with ease. This is a signal for continuing.

East = Action excited you but you faced resistance. This is a signal that a pivot is required.

South = Action felt tiring and you faced resistance. This is a signal that you need to rest and / or stop.

West = Action felt tiring but it led to a new opportunity dropping in. This is a single to potentially explore a new opportunity.

quests.name: Map The Boundaries Of Your Nervous System
quests.description: Identify how much money your nervous system feels safe earning before it self-sabotages
quests.learnMore:
Your nervous system has invisible boundaries around money, visibility, and success.

When you approach these edges, your body creates resistance through self-sabotage, procrastination, or fear.

This flow uses sway testing (a muscle-testing practice) to identify exactly where those boundaries are empowering you to consciously expand them.

The flow takes about 10 minutes and since you'll be sway-testing it's recommended you do it at home.

quests.name: Healing Compass
quests.description: Identify the wound/s causing your Protective Voice to protect you
quests.learnMore:
The Healing Compass is a reflective process that helps you trace your protective patterns back to their origin.

Your protective voice developed as a survival mechanism‚Äîunderstanding the original wound allows you to heal it at the root, rather than just managing symptoms.

This process typically takes 10-15 minutes and will help you gain clarity on why certain patterns keep showing up in your life and what you need to heal to stop them.

quests.name: Identify Your Curiosities
quests.description: What was the topic of a podcast, book, or learning that you absolutely loved this week?
quests.placeholder: The more specific the topic the better
quests.learnMore:
Your curiosities are breadcrumbs leading to what your essence is passionate about and the impact it wants to make in the world.

The topics you're excited to learn about reveal what you're meant to share with the world.

Most people dismiss their interests as 'just hobbies,' but tracking them over time reveals patterns that point to your unique genius and potential business opportunities.

quests.name: Daily Release Challenge
quests.description: Check the group chat to see the daily release challenge for the day.
quests.placeholder: What came up for you in this process today?

quests.name: Processing Your Emotions
quests.description: When you found yourself feeling negatively charged (anger, fear, guilt, shame) today, rather than bottle it up (a recipe for trauma to develop and future resentment + fear blocks), how did you release it healthily?
quests.placeholder: What emotion were you feeling and how did you release it?
quests.learnMore:
Emotions are energy in motion‚Äî see them as a song. When we suppress them, it's like clicking pause in the middle of the song. They get stored in the body and create tension, anxiety and if intense enough, trauma.

Release practices include anything that allow you to experience the emotion and process it so the 'song finishes'. Examples include: running, journaling, breathwork, movement, crying, shaking, screaming (into a pillow), or simply allowing yourself to feel without judgment.

The goal isn't to 'fix' the emotion but to experience it. Doing any of these practises for 90 seconds is often enough for the emotion to pass through you and the 'song to finish'.

quests.name: Big Release
quests.description: Complete an extended release whether it be breathwork or another release practise of your choosing
quests.placeholder: What came up in the session? What did you process and release?
quests.learnMore:
Extended release practices (30+ minutes) allow you to access and clear deeper layers of stored emotion and trauma.

Options include: conscious-connected breathwork, somatic experiencing, rage rituals, ecstatic dance, or guided emotional release sessions.

These practices often bring up unexpected emotions‚Äîtrust the process and let your body lead.

quests.name: Embody Your Essence

quests.placeholder: What did you do?

quests.name: Dopamine Diet Change
quests.description: What's a moment where instead of defaulting to 'fast-food' joy, you pursued 'nutritious' joy instead?
quests.placeholder: What 'fast-food' joy do you usually default to and what was the 'nutritious' joy you chose instead?
quests.learnMore:
Fast-food joy is anything where you feel good in the moment, but leaves you feeling lower after. Think: drinking alcohol, eating high-sugar foods, scrolling social media, watching netflix.

Nutritious joy is anything where you suffer but it leaves you feeling better after. Think: purposeful work, going to the gym, vulnerable conversations with friends/family, learning something new.

The more you choose nutritious joy, the less you'll crave the fast-food hits. You're literally rewiring your brain's reward system.

quests.name: Make It A Hell Yea
quests.description: What event this week flowed into your life that was an immediate "hell yea" or what event wasn't a hell yea but you turned into one by changing something about it?
quests.placeholder: What event this week was a Hell Yea for you?
quests.learnMore:
What's the difference between an A-grade actor and a C-grade actor who started with the same talent? One said yes to any opportunity and found themselves too busy to say yes to the "hell yea" ones when they did come and one said yes to only "Hell Yea" opportunities which led to more hell yeas.

By bringing awareness to what a "hell yea" is for you also shows what you're interested in and what you want to be doing.

quests.name: Groan challenge
quests.description: A groan is something your essence knows you're capable of but your body still resists. It's something that feels outside your comfort zone but you know that you can do.
quests.placeholder: What groan task did you complete?
quests.learnMore:
A 'groan' is something that you know you can do but terrifies you often due to a fear of judgement. These are tasks that accelerate your growth most.

The groan indicates you're at an edge. Groan tasks might include: recording a video, asking for feedback, learning a new tool, or practicing a skill publicly before you feel 'ready.'

quests.name: 3% Better
quests.description: In your business what can you make 3% better this week?
quests.placeholder: What did you improve by 3%?
quests.learnMore:
The 3% rule focuses on marginal gains as a recipe for success instead of massive transformation.These small consistent improvements compound exponentially.

Instead of 'I need to completely overhaul my website,' you ask 'What's 3% better?' Maybe it's improving one headline, simplifying your offer, or speeding up your response time. Tiny improvements sustained over time create massive growth.

This quest is about giving your essence permission to play‚Äîeven if it feels scary. Examples: singing in public, sharing your art, dancing freely, speaking your truth, trying something new without being 'good' at it. The fear is the doorway.

quests.name: Environment Hygiene
quests.description: Identify and remove yourself from an environment, relationship, or situation that drains your essence.
quests.placeholder: What negative environment did you address?
quests.learnMore: When you put hot water and cold water in the same glass, the temperature meets in the middle. Human's are the same, this is why we become the average of our 5 closest friends and why the content we consume shapes our worldview. Sometimes the most impactful thing you can do is remove yourself from spaces, people, or situations that drain your energy or require you to be someone you're not. This might mean unfollowing accounts, leaving a group, setting a boundary with a friend, or quitting a role. Protecting your energy is not selfish‚Äîit's essential.
